{{also|handy|händy}} ==English== {{wikipedia}} ===Etymology=== Originating as a nickname for a [[handy]] person. ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun}} # {{surname|en|from=nicknames}} # {{lb|en|rare}} {{given name|en|male|from=English}}. ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=adhny|Haydn}} ---- ==German== {{was fwotd|de|2013|April|2}} {{wikipedia|lang=de}} [[File:Siemens-sx1.png|thumb|100px|Handy]] ===Etymology=== From {{bor|de|en|handy}}. According to some commentators, the German meaning is originally German, whereas others claim there was an early, but now neglected, antetype of it in English. More likely, however, is that ''handy'' is a condensed form of ''Handfunktelefon'', which was how it was marketed by electronic firms such as Bosch and Hagenuk.Elizabeth M Christopher, ''International Management: Explorations Across Cultures'', Kogan Page Publishers, 2012, p. 272. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈhɛndi/}} * {{audio|de|De-Handy.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n|Handys|Handys}} #{{lb|de|mobile phones}}, [[mobile phone]], [[mobile]], [[cell phone]], [[phone]] {{gloss|portable, wireless telephone}} #* '''1994 May 11''', Ralf Schlüter, [http://www.berliner-zeitung.de/archiv/willy-sommerfeld--berlins-bekanntester-kinopianist--feiert-90--geburtstag-stimmungen-frei-hand,10810590,8833750.html "Stimmungen frei Hand"], ''Berliner Zeitung'': #*: Alle paar Minuten hängt er am '''Handy''' und macht Termine klar. #*:: Every few minutes he's on his '''cell phone''' arranging appointments. #* '''2008''', Ulrich Breymann and Heiko Mosemann, ''Java me'', Hanser Verlag, {{ISBN|3446413766}}, [http://books.google.de/books?id=FwSzVpr1rAAC&pg=PA283&dq=%22Handys%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=8Bb_UJPCK9DptQb_kYDAAg&redir_esc=y p. 283]: #*: Bluetooth ist eine drahtlose Kommunikationstechnologie. Der Ursprung dieser Technologie liegt im Jahre 1994, als die Firma Ericsson eine Alternative zu Kabeln für die Verbindung ihrer '''Handys''' zum Zubehör wie Headsets suchte. #*:: Bluetooth is a wireless communication technology. This technology originated in 1994, when Ericsson was looking for an alternative to cables for connecting their '''cell phones''' to accessories like headsets. #* '''2009''', Ernst Stahl, ''E-Commerce-Leitfaden'', ibi research, {{ISBN|3868450203}}, [http://books.google.de/books?id=COXwd27203QC&pg=PA123&dq=%22sein+Handy%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=xhX_ULrgC4iktAbAoYD4Cw&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=%22sein%20Handy%22&f=false p.123]: #*: Der Kunde hält sein '''Handy''' zum Bezahlen einfach an ein Lesegerät und der Betrag wird von seinem Konto abgebucht. #*:: To pay, the customer just holds his '''cell phone''' up to a reader and the amount is deducted from his account. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-n|s|s}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|Mobiltelefon}} * {{l|de|Natel}} {{qualifier|Switzerland}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|handyfrei}} * {{l|de|Handyvertrag}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ===References=== [[Category:German pseudo-anglicisms]] ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Etymology=== Via {{der|lb|de|Handy}} from {{der|lb|en|handy}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|lb|/ˈhændi/}} ===Noun=== {{lb-noun|m|Handyen}} # [[mobile phone]], [[mobile]] #: {{ux|lb|Hien däerf den '''Handy''' vu sengem eelere Brudder benotzen.|He may use his elder brother's mobile phone.}} [[Category:lb:Telecommunications]]
